channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report I-2024010051
item.description:
Report I-2024010051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fifteen minutes after departing from BOS, the customer observed their crossbody bag that they were wearing smelled strongly of the e-cigarette juice. Upon opening the zipper compartment holding the e-cigarette he saw the blue light on and was unable to switch it off. The customer immediately notified a Flight Attendant to assist with the situation. The Purser obtained the e-cigarette and utilized the fire containment bag. The crew maintained custody of the containment bag until arrival in LAX when it was tendered to the CSM who met the flight.

item.title: Report X-2024080786
item.description:
Report X-2024080786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 830928 in a wet state. Package was placed in a tote for QA. Upon inspection, contents are 4 bottles of isopropyl alcohol, with 1 bottle having a loose cap, causing its liquid contents to spill out. No protection for caps or prevention from bottles from moving was the likely cause of the cap becoming loose. Better inner packing for both bottles and caps would help prevent caps from becoming loose.

item.description:

  • City: SAN DIEGO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipments were discovered during sort operations. The shipments were being returned to the sender when the undeclared dg was discovered. There are 11 identical shipments from the shipper going to 11 different recipients. Each plastic bag contained: 1 plastic bottle of Instant Power Hair and Grease Drain Opener Cleaner@ 2Liters inside of a plastic bag. NO Release. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation. 2773 8679 1655 2773 8687 4060 2773 8677 2693 2773 8695 8386 2773 8697 0056 2773 8686 7193 2773 8688 5067 2773 8682 2614 2773 8695 2002 2773 8678 6255 2773 8680 2288

item.title: Report X-2024080452
item.description:
Report X-2024080452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: Commerce
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container EMHU 641440 was releasing at the East Yard in Commerce, CA. Contractor responded and found inadequate blocking and bracing causing a load shift. Four pails of UN3082 released 4-5 gallons outside the container and 10-12 gallons inside the container. United Pumping (contractor) secured the load and cleaned all impacted areas. Damaged pails were overpacked and placed back in the container.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1490 Cairox Potassium Permanganate Free-Flowing Grade from 1-55 gal DM due to a forklift/skid puncture. The release impacted 541-3037 trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024080281
item.description:
Report E-2024080281

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) pounds of material was released due to a forklift damaging one(1) super sack. Clean Harbors personnel transferred the remaining material into a new super sack and then swept up the released material. The damaged super sack and recovered material were placed into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024080277

Report E-2024080277

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-ounce of Gaze N Seal Green Concrete & Masonry Lacquer was released from a 5-gallon metal pail. The release impacted the wrapping inside trailer #3159451. Product had dried so no absorbents were used. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

X-2024080538 The package was found torn and upon inspection the package was a hazmat item. The venting allowed powder to seep out damaging the packaging. 4. X-2024080539 The package was damaged by the contents venting and allowing powder of the item to discolor and tear the package box. 5. X-2024080540 The package was torn and discolored when the contents vented. The items were a oxidizing item.
